The genus <em>Klebsiella includes eight species of bacteria ubiquitously found in natural environments . Microgravity is a key component of the study .
AmpC β-lactamases are not inhibited by β-laminate inhibitors such as clavulanic acid . AmpC is not recommended for the treatment of <em>K. aerogenes-associated infections .

The most common ST among the strains was ST138 (7/8 <em>K. pneumoniae> subsp. <em>. <em > strain F3-2P (2) belongs to the ST101 lineage with KL106 and O1/O2v2 . Genes responsible for mercuric resistance, arsenical resistance, copper resistance and copper resistance were  K. pneumoniae ST101 is a globally distributed clone with over 696 isolates reported in over 33 countries . Overall, the ST101 lineage genomes exhibited high genetic similarity (ANI > 99.4%) and are predominantly associated with Europe and South East Asia .
Based on core-genome phylogeny, IIIF7SW-P1 formed a distinct node within the ST103 clone along with uropathogenic strain SRR5666484 .
Genome determinants of resistance and virulence are genetic determinants . The study was published in the US National Institute for Genome sequencing .

The genome of <em>K. pneumoniae . F3-2P (2) encoded for 75 VFs, amonst which were the virulence loci for enterobactin and yersiniabactin . Of note, isolate F3.2P belongs to the emerging nosocomial high-risk clone ST101 . The ST101 clone has been  The predominant virulence factor associated with ST101 is yersiniabactin, as part of a horizontally acquired and self-mobilizable ICEKp . Among the 696 ST101 genomes available on the Pathogenwatch surveillance database, only four esxhibited the same ICEKP5 harboring the ybt-14 gene cluster .

The mode of transportation of a potential pathogen such as K. pneumoniae to the ISS could be through cargo or crew, although relevant crew data were not available as NASA does not mandate the monitoring of microbial diversity . The hypervirulent, multimetal resistance, and thermotolerant genomic profile of the strain could possibly allow it to evade existing disinfecting protocols aboard the ISS .

The ISS K. quasipneumoniae ST138 strains lacked any MGEs and, therefore, their adaptability advantage is likely ntrinsic . There is not much known about the dissemination and persistence of the ST3234 strain . The strain IIIF7SWSW-P1 (ST103) was isolated from the ISS Lab3
